name: Embassy Suites Dallas Frisco

reviews.title: Embassy Suites Frisco is the best one yet!
reviews.text: We just returned from a Sat. night stay with our grandson. Embassy Suites is our favorite hotel and we normally spend 10 to 12 nights a year at different locations around Dallas and Austin. The Frisco location is by far the best one yet. We had a balcony suite that was extremely large in compariision to other Embassy Suites hotels, it also faced directly at the Roughrider field. This made it where we could sit on our balcony and watch the game. The staff were very attentive and made us feel very welcome. The rooms were clean, towel animals on the bed were an added surprise, and breakfast was great as usual. I would definately recommend this hotel, you will not be sorry you stayed at the Embassy Suites, Frisco, Texas.
I was aliitle concerned due to some earlier reviews, however we were very pleased with our four day stay.Great location.Across the street from Stonebrier Mall. I will stay there again in the future.
reviews.title: Great staff- very good breakfast.

reviews.text: We stayed at the embassy suites in Frisco, Tx this past Saturday night. We originally booked for 2 nights. Our stay was so miserable we checked out early and did not stay the second night. Be warned about this... They charged us $75 to check out early. There was NO apology for our concerns or any offer to comp the early check out
reviews.title: We stayed at the embassy suites in...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: fee. The service was horrible. There was a roughriders game, a hockey game and a convention going on. The parking lot was completely full and the only option was to valet. The valet was extremely rude and very slow. The room (1219) smelled like dirt and must and then like they'd "sprayed" over it. The shower curtain had mildew and black hair on the floor. The couch cushions were stained, as were the dining table chairs. You'd expect the room at the ES to be luxurious and spacious. It was NOT! Linens are outdated. Rooms are small! The worst part was the hit air coming from what they call the "fresh air vent". It was 97 degrees on Saturday, so imagine how hot the fresh air was. Our room got so hot in the night we had to open the door to the hallway to get cool
reviews.title: Bed bug bites and poor customer service

reviews.text: air in. It was horrible!!! Again, we were never offered any apology or compensation for any if this. The assistant simply did not care. It was obvious! We love staying at Embassy Suites but we will never stay here again!!!
reviews.title: Clean and comfortable with a polite, accommodating staff.

reviews.text: I booked a wheelchair accessible room for my daughter and myself over Thanksgiving. Although on first appearance the room seemed OK in that my daughter who uses a wheelchair could get into the bathroom and bedroom areas easily. However, after the first night, we realized how mistaken we were on first appearance. The roll in shower, after one use, flooded the entire bathroom floor, as the shower was neither sloped for better drainage nor had a barrier dam to prevent the water from spreading. Everything that had been on the bathroom floor was soaked. In addition, the beds were fairly high off the ground so I had to assist her into the bed as she couldn't do it on her own because of the height. This problem, however, we could live with. When I reported the shower problem to the front desk, they sent the plumber up to the room since they thought it was simply a clogged drain. He checked it out and confirmed that the shower was poorly designed and that there was no plugged drain. He reported his findings back to the front desk and they suggested that I form a towel barricade on the floor to prevent the water from spreading. They said no one had complained before about this situation, so they were willing to provide me with an extra supply of towels each day for that purpose. I asked for the manager who then suggested that we transfer to a non wheelchair accessible room. I said I would consider that, even knowing that my daughter would probably have to crawl into the bathroom, but only if they could provide me with a common tub seat that fits across a tub so she could at least use the tub for bathing. The manager said that they only had a tub chair that was about 36 to 48 inches in length and that it would only fit across the tub in a lengthwise or diagonal direction. I said that that would be useless because it would prevent her from safely moving to the bottom of the tub for sitting. Because we were at the Embassy Suites for a family reunion with more than 6 other rooms already booked by our relatives, I saw no other alternative but to stay in the wheelchair accessible room with the daily flooding floor. Each morning I would put the towel barrier down around the shower and then call the front desk for clean up. Sometimes they arrived promptly, some days not until after 6 p.m.
reviews.title: Rooms unacceptable for disabled guests

reviews.text: The day I went to check out, I expressed my unhappiness with my visit and asked to speak to the manager. I told him that although I generally find this chain to be top notch, I would not return to this one because of our recent experience. I asked him what would he have done if he were in my shoes. He replied that I should have moved to another hotel. As mentioned previously, with a family reunion at this hotel, that would have been ridiculous, particularly since we were all sharing cars. I told him, in that case, I will warn other disabled travelers that they should look elsewhere for accommodations as the Embassy Suites in Frisco apparently could care less for their business.
reviews.title: Friendly hotel with a great breakfast

reviews.text: I stayed at Embassy Suites Dallas for 4 nights in October 2010, I was travelling there on a business trip but my family would have loved this place. Excellent location with easy access to highways, still not noisy. Great fitness center, pool and bubble pool. The hotel is als close to Stonebriar shopping center, you could actually walk there. Free paking in the roofed parking garage next to hotel. The rooms are large, double sized to a normal room. The breakfast was very good, all you need and fresh.
reviews.title: decent hotel with staff that doesn't care

reviews.text: On the negative side. Wifi connection in room is very slow.
reviews.title: We had a corner room suite and loved. We...

reviews.text: decent rooms..good food in the restaurant...decent breakfast and manager's reception every evening..but the attitude of the front desk staff and the valet staff takes away from it all and leaves you with a bad taste in your mouth at the end of the stay..no concern or respect for the guest
reviews.title: Great stay at the Embassy as always

reviews.text: Now I may be biased because i usually stay in hostels but this hotel was great. We were at an event at the connecting convention centre and everything we needed was right there. Staff was attentive, rooms were clean, beds comfy and wi fi was free!
reviews.title: Really Great Hotel

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for a night away. I booked our room with Hilton Honors points. When we arrived, we were surprised to find that we had been given the George Purefoy suite on the 14th floor (penthouse floor). The room overlooked center field of the Dr. Pepper ballpark. The room was incredible. We had an extra large shower, jacuzzi tub, and a ton of amenities. We were also given complimentary parking. Breakfast was great as was the evening manager's reception.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.text: Good Service, beautiful hotel and room, clean, comfortable. Good margaritas. Great free breakfast. Here come the complaints, (sorry) Pool too cold, hot tub lukewarm. Ice machine on second floor part of a poor design in my own opinion. Too close to public restroom entrances, in the same alcove.
reviews.title: Beautiful, comfy, with impecipble service

reviews.text: Back to the up side: IKEA and other great shopping very close. Close to Dr Pepper Ball park (could watch a game from our room). Also, even though the hotel is basically geared toward families, it was quiet. Room looked modern and classy.
reviews.title: Great during weekdays - avoid weekends

reviews.text: Checked in on a Saturday and checked out on the next Saturday.
reviews.title: Good and comfortable suites for extended business and leisure travel

reviews.text: This is our second time to stay at this hotel. It's located right beside the Dr Pepper BallPark, we got to see a fireworks show beside the hotel after the game. Tons of restaurants and shopping centers are within a block of the hotel. The rooms are spacious, clean and nice. The staff is very friendly and professional, breakfast is to die for and the kids enjoyed the pool/hot tub which is indoor. The only problem we had was the people in the room next door were partying until 2AM which kept us awake and then some other parents were letting their young girls run up and down the halls and in and out of the elevators. We didn't complain to Mgmt about it so I guess that wasn't their fault. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone. It was great!!!
reviews.title: Great Family Fun!!!

reviews.text: We are Hilton Honors members and for a close-by weekend getaway we like the Embassy Suites in Frisco. I doubt if we will return for a 'staycation' due to the following reasons: Outdated televsion with remotes that do not work properly (2nd trip with this issue) $14.95 for Internet service and $8.00 to park. We were very shocked by the last two mentioned charges. When I was in disbelief of the parking fee when checking out, the person at the desk didn't even make eye contact and try to explain which was poor.
reviews.title: Staycation - Too many Fees

reviews.text: First of all, we had a corner room ,living room so small you are a foot from the tv. Outdated tv no flat screens, Balcony in corner room a big joke very very small dont waste your time getting a balcony room. Room service food was terrible and kids meal xtra small no chicken 3 tiny tiny pieces. Breakfast was terrible ,food was either burned or undercooked as a bird is flying all around you and landing on all the chairs in the breakfast area ..Nasty ! General manager Bill Bretchers is a fake and unconcerned.
reviews.title: Don't be fooled by looks of this hotel ,rooms xtra small, worst general manager

reviews.text: Beware LOOKS are deceiving at this hotel.
reviews.title: Horrible Customer Service
Excellent Overall Unless You Need Heat
reviews.text: Hotel facilities are nice, great location and good rooms but staff failed miserably -- group reservation wrong and hotel staff never fixed it or apologized. Wrong type of rooms and did not have all the rooms reserved for over five months. Did not clean all the rooms and had a hard time getting clean towels for three day stay. Staff was horrible at customer service.

aka: Embassy Suites Dallas Frisco Hotel Frisco
description: The beautiful Embassy Suites Frisco Convention Center and Spa is located in the heart of Frisco. Frisco is the most booming place in the USA! So much is happening here! We are a four diamond, four star Embassy Suites! We boast over three hundred and thirty wonderfully appointed suites. We have that special four diamond, four star service that will exceed all of your expectations. The Embassy Frisco features a full service SPA BOTANICA which has everything from pedicures to body massages. The perfect place to relax from a meeting or sneak away for a romantic weekend.Talk about meeting space; we got you covered! The Embassy Frisco has a full convention center with over 90,000 square feet of flexible space that can accommodate up to two thousand! Whether you are coming in for that special meeting or family reunion- we do it all! Don't forget weddings! We have a special coordinator to assist your every need.The Embassy Frisco is close to everything to do! We are steps away from Dr Pepper Arena. We have views that overlook the Roughriders stadium. Close to many restaurants and shopping shopping shopping! Right across the street from Stonebrier mall and all they have to offer! So come on over to Frisco Embassy Convention Center and Spa- we will exceed all your expectations.
